last_episode_to_air.name: The New Kid/The Princess and the Frog
last_episode_to_air.overview: The New Kid: After Riff makes friends with new kid Noah, BJ becomes jealous and thinks he is not Riff's friend anymore. Barney teaches him that you can always keep your old friendships and make new ones too. The Princess and the Frog: After Baby Bop promises Ryan to watch his pet frog, Barney tells her the story of "The Princess and the Frog" to remind her to always keep her promises.

name: Barney & Friends
overview: Barney & Friends is an American children's television series aimed at children from ages 2 to 5. The series, which first aired on April 6, 1992, features the title character Barney, a purple anthropomorphic Tyrannosaurus rex who conveys educational messages through songs and small dance routines with a friendly, optimistic attitude.

episodes.name: The Queen of Make-Believe
episodes.overview: It looks like rain. But Min has decided to become the Queen Of Make-Believe. Suddenly, it looks like lots of fun! With Barney leading his Friends on a romp of games, songs and activities. They put on a pretend tea-party, build a robot with boxes, they even create some special ""stretching exercises"" for the imagination. Pretending, make-believing or imagining- children learn it's always called fun.

episodes.name: My Family's Just Right for Me
episodes.overview: It's the eve of ""Family Night"" at school. A super time for Barney & Friends to celebrate all those wonderful folks (and even pets!) at home. With paintings, books, songs, and dances. There's just one glitch to the gala; Kathy's not sure her ""small"" family measures up. It's just her Mom, her grandmother and herself. But after Barney gets through with his fun and games, the children realize that a family is defined by love, not by size.

episodes.name: Playing It Safe
episodes.overview: Barney and his friends learn some fun lessons about ""playing it safe."" The kids create cardboard-box cars to teach the rules about seatbelt use and crossing the street safely. To teach Baby Bop about strangers, a classroom version of Little Red Riding Hood is performed. Great music and special lyrics help reinforce the safety lessons.

episodes.name: Hop to It!
episodes.overview: When Tina and Luci are playing basketball, Tina is disappointed when she can't play as well as her older sister or the other big kids. Barney stops by to show Tina all the great things she can do with exercise. Barney and the kids play games and sing songs about exercise and find out how fun it is to learn about their bodies. With new found energy and confidence, Tina ends up playing basketball as well as the others.

episodes.name: Eat, Drink and Be Healthy!
episodes.overview: Barney and his friends discover they have plenty of ""food for thought"" as they learn about nutrition. Discovering the four food groups and the importance of eating healthy snacks allows Barney, Baby Bop and their friends to have fun together. An imaginative rhyming story tells about the perils of being a picky eater. A friend of Barney's sings a humorous song about meals that would ""bug"" most diners. Special songs and lyrics reinforce the lesson that eating healthy foods is the right thing to do.

episodes.name: Four Seasons Day
episodes.overview: Talk about the weather! The kids do much more than that as Barney squeezes all four seasons into one rollicking make-believe holiday. You won't believe how much fun you can have celebrating the wind, rain, and the snow. There's a barrel-full of songs about Spring's showers, Summer's warmth, Fall's leaves, and Winter's chill.

episodes.name: The Treasure of Rainbow Beard
episodes.overview: After the kids and Barney enjoy reading a scary pirate book, the book's character, Rainbow Beard, appears and gives them a treasure map of their own to solve. In order to find the treasure, the group must learn a variety of songs and games about colors and shapes. When they finally find the treasure the kids get a big surprise and learn a valuable lesson about sharing with others.

episodes.name: Going Places!
episodes.overview: After Luci and Tina leave for a plane trip to their grandmother's house, the other kids wish they could travel too. Barney drops by and takes them for a trip on ""Barney Airlines, Destination: Imagination City!"" Once in ""Imagination City,"" the group envisions a variety of sights to see and all the many fun ways of getting there: a car, a camel, a hot air balloon, and even just by walking.

episodes.name: Caring Means Sharing
episodes.overview: Barney is a very large dinosaur--but there may not be enough of him to go around when Min and Kathy quarrel over whose turn it is to play with their big purple pal. Coming from a big family, Min is tired of sharing--but joins her friends in an exploration of ways to share fun and work. Baby Bop learns a lesson about being greedy; a puppet show of ""The Little Red Hen"" teaches that rewards and responsibilities are linked.

episodes.name: Down on Barney's Farm
episodes.overview: The kid's learn and draw pictures of farm animals, but Shawn is unhappy with his drawing when no one knows what it is. Barney pops in to cheer him up and show the children an imaginary farm firsthand.

episodes.name: What's That Shadow?
episodes.overview: A sudden thunderstorm chases the kids into the classroom, where they are frightened by the rain, thunder and lightning. Barney arrives and tells them how to use positive thoughts to change their fears into fun. The kids make silly monster artwork, and then pretend they are funny, friendly monsters. Barney also helps Shawn overcome his fear of dogs when he meets Min's canine friend, Molly.

episodes.name: Happy Birthday, Barney!
episodes.overview: It's Barney birthday and everyone is excited about throwing him the best party ever, using classroom materials and their imagination! Barney teaches his friends about birthday customs around the world and that receiving gifts is not the most important part of birthdays.

episodes.name: Alphabet Soup!
episodes.overview: When Barney arrives to play with his friends, Derek, plays ""alphabet fun"" by spelling a ""mystery word"" a letter at a time. The group plays games and sings songs related to each letter of the mystery word. Rhyming words, making alphabet soup, walking through the alphabet, and seeing how, many letters they can make with their bodies, gives the children many chances to play with letters and words. Children learn that having fun with letters and words and learning the alphabet are the first steps to reading.

episodes.name: Our Earth, Our Home
episodes.overview: The school's ""Earth Week"" has Barney and his friends all abuzz about things they can do to protect the earth. Through fun-filled songs, the children learn the importance of recycling... how to make new things out of old...how to conserve water, air and land clean. The children form a ""trashcan"" band performing a silly symphony song and do a skit about Johny Appleseed. Sharing and caring for the earth become a ""fun thing"" to do.

episodes.name: Let's Help Mother Goose!
episodes.overview: Mother Goose needs help! A bookworm has eaten the pages from her book of nursery rhymes, and Barney & Friends must help her remember the missing rhymes! Songs, dances, puzzles and puppets showcase more than 20 favorite rhymes...

episodes.name: Be a Friend
episodes.overview: Barney finds Tosha, a new girl at school, lonely and without friends. He introduces her to Michael, Derek, and Kathy. Together, they learn why doing things with friends is much more fun than being alone. At the same time, Derek and Michael must learn the true meaning of friendship and sharing when they cannot agree on who should get possession of a picture they made together.

episodes.name: I Just Love Bugs!
episodes.overview: Barney & Friends are really ""going buggy"" as they discover the world of bugs and insects around us. Tina gains confidence being a girl who likes bugs. Michael shares a story about ants and teaches his friends about good work habits. Stories and songs introduce other bugs and insects...and a surprising visitor ""drops in"" on Little Miss Muffet, to teach a lesson about accepting others who are different.

episodes.name: When I Grow Up…
episodes.overview: Getting big is a big responsibility--and Shawn and the other kids are worried about doing a grown-up job. Barney guides his friends through the many careers there are to choose from, and shows how many jobs are linked to activities children are already familiar with.

episodes.name: 1-2-3-4-5 Senses!
episodes.overview: Luci introduces her new friend, Patty (who is visually impaired), to Barney, Michael, Tina and Kathy. Patty comments that a beautiful day can be experienced through more of one's senses than just sight. Michael's class is studying the five senses, which leads to fun songs and activities related to each of them. Perhaps most important, Patty shows the group that a child with blindness can do many things for him/herself and play right along with the others. Patty teaches the kids a rhyme and its corresponding hand movements...and she reads a story to Kathy, using braille.

episodes.name: Practice Makes Music
episodes.overview: Michael is scheduled to play a cello solo at the school concert in a few days and he is nervous about playing in front of all those people. Barney invites his friend Greg Murray to teach the kids about music and help Michael learn that ""practice makes perfect."" Barney and his friends learn to identify musical instruments and their sounds and appreciate all the different varieties of music.

episodes.name: Hi, Neighbor!
episodes.overview: Barney & Friends are in the mood for an adventure--and they have one, when they all help Baby Bop learn more about neighborhoods! Imagination makes the journey magical with role-playing, an ""invisible dog"" chase, a scary visit to Dinosaur Days, and trips to make-believe versions of neighborhood points of interest! Even an ordinary neighborhood is filled with fun, songs, and surprises when it's explored ""Barney-style.

episodes.name: A Camping We Will Go!
episodes.overview: Barney's friends wish to camp in the woods and Barney makes there wish come true. While there they meet woodland creatures like a raccoon and a kookaburra. Lucy also tells them a scary story wish isn't really scary but truly funny. They make smores. They finally go home.

episodes.name: A Splash Party, Please
episodes.overview: The kids have planned a picnic and Barney's invited. After enjoying some healthy fare, the kids have fun with bubbles. Baby Bop arrives and a ""Splash Party"" ensues, incorporating all sorts of water activities. The kids show they know their manners by being polite and curtious to one another.

episodes.name: Carnival of Numbers
episodes.overview: Someone (i don't remember who) needs to learn how to count. Barney makes a carnival of numbers on the playground. They play limbo, throw a football through the tire swing, bowl, and have a pretend ride. The ticket person is Lucy. They each get 5 tickets.(i think) At the end the person knows how to count.

episodes.name: A World of Music
episodes.overview: The kids wish they could travel to other countries to see them firsthand. Barney & Friends use their imagination to travel to Scotland, Israel, Africa, China and Mexico, where hosts expose them to different songs, costumes, and customs. The kids hear music played on interesting instruments and learn new dance steps. They also learn that several of their favorite songs have roots in other lands.

episodes.name: Doctor Barney is Here!
episodes.overview: An upcoming trip to the Doctor has Kathy feeling blue. Abig dose of purple is just what she needs. Barney and friends to the rescue. They get her laughing with some zany songs then lead her through make believe visit too the Doctor. The check up includes receiving a shot.This shows kids that it is not so bad when you know about them before hand. The kds sing and dance their way through Barneys famous "" feel good rules"" to keep those young bodies strong .

episodes.name: Oh, What a Day!
episodes.overview: Tina is having a dismal day. The greatest misfortune came when her kitten ran out the door. Barney helps turn things around by making rhythm instruments, dancing, amd drawing faces.

episodes.name: Home Sweet Homes
episodes.overview: Barney lectures on animals' homes based on children's pictures. The children also draw pictures of different houses for people.

episodes.name: ¡Hola, Mexico!
episodes.overview: Luci tells everyone about her grandfather, whose birthday had been a few days back. Barney recommends that everyone hold a fiesta. Everyone gets in on the fiesta music, and they are surprised to see a folk dancer.

episodes.name: Everyone is Special
episodes.overview: Tina doesn't think she is special in anyway. Barney points out a special talent in all of his friends. He says he has a special surprise for everyone that will show them someone special, It is a mirror.

episodes.name: Honk! Honk! A Goose on the Loose!
Having Tens of Fun!
episodes.overview: The kids are in for ""tens of fun"" when Barney's friend, Mr. Tenagain, visits. His passion for all ""things 10"" leads to the reading of ""Ten, Nine, Eight"" and an account of Mr. Tenagain's trip to the moon. Snack time generates some antics in the kitchen, and a delightful picnic - visited by some rather unusual ants! Finally, Mr. Tenagain leaves surprise instructions on the ""nicest way to count to 10.

episodes.name: Play Ball!
episodes.overview: Barney introduces the kids to his Vend-O-Ball Machine. He tells them they can press any of the yellow buttons because they dispense various types of balls, but nobody is to press the red button on the bottom, because it has a problem. The kids take turns pressing the buttons and learn about different ball activities such as bowling and golf. Scooter, curious what will happen if one presses the bottom button, asks Baby Bop to do so, and it dispenses so many balls, all the kids come to clean up, and Scooter apologizes for causing the chaos.

episodes.name: Howdy, Friends!
episodes.overview: Barney takes the kids to a ranch to learn about the cowboy lifestyle and meet the singing cowboy trio Riders In The Sky.

episodes.name: You Can Do It!
episodes.overview: The kids find out that learning something new takes practice. Keesha, Stephen, and Jeff help Barney teach Baby Bop to jump rope.

episodes.name: All Aboard!
episodes.overview: Barney's friends are racing to clean up the park, but Kami has trouble keeping up with the other kids - even when they pretend to be ants marching in a parade! Barney and Scott visit the Idea Bench where Scott comes up with a great idea - to show Kami that even though the caboose is the last car in the train, it's the most important because that's where the conductor rides. With Kami playing "Conductor for the Day," they learn all about trains and have fun checking out a model train. Then, they work together to clean up the old caboose in the park as they sing "I've Been Working On the Railroad." When Barney tells them how railroad signal flags are used, the children make their own flags and wave them around the park. Barney's friends learn that from the first to the last in line, everyone is special.

episodes.name: Red, Yellow, and Blue!
episodes.overview: Singing and dancing their way through a color-filled day of learning, Barney and friends search for red, yellow, and blue objects to complete their color collection.

episodes.name: This Way In! This Way Out!
Play It Safe!
episodes.overview: Barney reminds Baby Bop that bandages are for real injuries; safety rules for playgrounds.

episodes.name: Three Lines, Three Corners
episodes.overview: From a chalk hopscotch board made of triangles, the kids explore the shapes around them. The triangle gets the most exposure, from rooftops to paper hats.

episodes.name: B.J.'s Really Cool House
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop and the kids discuss the different rooms in a house while B.J. makes a house of his own. In the process, everyone learns what parts of a house are important.

episodes.name: On Again, Off Again
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop and the children learn about on and off.

episodes.name: Everybody's Got Feelings
episodes.overview: Little people have big feelings, as Barney relates. He gets his friends to make masks of faces. Barney helps B.J. and Baby Bop with their mad feelings. Shot on location is the song Colors Make Me Happy.

episodes.name: Caring Hearts
episodes.overview: In their school project, the kids attach hearts with names of people they care about, on a bare tree. Barney helps the kids get a wide view of all the people who care about them. Their friends-and-family tree ""blooms"" considerably.

episodes.name: Let's Make Music!
episodes.overview: Barney tells the kids how rhythm is instrumental to music. It inspires the kids to start a marching band.

episodes.name: Movin' Along
episodes.overview: Barney steps in as the Simon of a Simon Says game. It starts everyone dancing and moving about. Midway through, Barney narrates a dramatization of The Tortoise and the Hare.

episodes.name: Let Your Creativity Fly!
episodes.overview: Laura, David, and Miguel find Barney's paper airplaneâ€“and set their imaginations on one goal: building a pretend airplane.

episodes.name: Coming On Strong
episodes.overview: Jackson, Miguel, Rachel, and ""Dr. Whitney"" play check-up to see how they have grown. Barney shares with them ways to help their bodies grow stronger and healthier. One way is to exercise.

episodes.name: Let's Play Games!
episodes.overview: B.J. pulls out a huge pile of balls and other things for playing games. But he needs friends to help him decide what game to play.

episodes.name: You Can Count On Me
episodes.overview: Kami, Rachel, and Nick go on Barney's number hunt. As Barney shows different number cards, the kids use their senses to find the real objects.

episodes.name: A Wonderful World of Colors and Shapes
My Friends, The Doctor and Dentist
Welcome, Cousin Riff
episodes.overview: Barney informs Baby Bop and BJ that their cousin Riff has moved into town!

episodes.name: Special Skills
episodes.overview: Baby Bop and BJ decide to put on a special puppet show in the park. Riff utilizes his music ability to enhance the show.

episodes.name: Airplanes
episodes.overview: BJ brings his new airplane toy to the park. Riff decides to borrow BJ's airplane toy. But when Riff can't seem to put BJ's toy airplane back together, BJ puts his toy airplane back together to make it good as new.

episodes.name: Boats
episodes.overview: Barney shows Baby Bop about boats. BJ and Baby Bop build a boat for Barney and Baby Bop.

episodes.name: Butterflies
episodes.overview: Baby Bop cares for a caterpillar that is going through metamorphosis.

episodes.name: Bugs
episodes.overview: BJ shows Barney, Baby Bop, Riff, and the kids his bug collection. When Riff is scared of bugs, Barney shows him that bugs can be cool!

episodes.name: Shapes
episodes.overview: At the shapes carnival in the park, Riff is upset that his good lucky medal is gone. Barney and his friends set out to help him find it.

episodes.name: Colors
episodes.overview: Baby Bop, BJ and the kids paint a big rainbow in the park.

episodes.name: Seeing
episodes.overview: Baby Bop tries to convince to BJ and Riff that she had seen an elephant in the park.

episodes.name: Hearing
episodes.overview: BJ and Riff compete to see who can make the loudest noise in the park.

episodes.name: Glad to Be Me
episodes.overview: Barney helps Riff overcome his shyness by introducing him to some friends.

episodes.name: Arts
episodes.overview: Barney introduces his friends to different forms of art at an art festival.

episodes.name: Movement
episodes.overview: Coach Baby Bop and BJ help Barney prepare for the sack race.

episodes.name: BJ's Snack Attack
episodes.overview: BJ's binge on sweet treats leads him to dream about a world full of sweet treats.

episodes.name: Counting
episodes.overview: To teach Baby Bop how to count, Barney takes her on a treasure hunt for buried treasure.

episodes.name: Letters
episodes.overview: Everyone makes a sign for Riff's music concert.

episodes.name: Pets
episodes.overview: When BJ loses Bryan's dog, he learns the importance of taking care of pets.

episodes.name: Vets
episodes.overview: When Baby Bop's teddy bear gets injured, Doctor Barney and Doctor Riff help fix her up.

episodes.name: Winter
episodes.overview: Baby Bop waits for the first snowfall of the year.

episodes.name: Summer
episodes.overview: It's summertime, and Everybody enjoys summer activities!

episodes.name: Caring
episodes.overview: It's Barney's Birthday, and his friends are throwing him a party. After many of Barney's friends give him store-bought presents, Riff questions if Barney would like his homemade gift.

episodes.name: Rhythm
episodes.overview: Barney and his friends perform a marching band parade to teach Baby Bop all about rhythm.

episodes.name: Playing Games
episodes.overview: Everyone teaches Baby Bop the importance of following the rules when playing games with friends.

episodes.name: Fun with Reading
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop and Riff help BJ's toe feel better.

episodes.name: Making Mistakes
episodes.overview: After BJ accidentally paints the caboose red, yellow, and blue on "Make the Park Pretty Day!"; Barney, Baby Bop, Riff, and the kids help him fix it by working together.

episodes.name: Separation
episodes.overview: Baby Bop is upset that she misses BJ and Riff, so Barney helps her by keeping friends close.

episodes.name: Days of the Week
episodes.overview: Barney comes up with fun activities for his friends to do during the week, as they wait for the petting zoo.

episodes.name: Sharing
episodes.overview: After Riff busts BJ's new scooter, he holds a rummage sale in order to buy a new one!

episodes.name: Rabbits
episodes.overview: Detective BJ helps Baby Bop figure out which animal is eating her snacks.

episodes.name: Ducks and Fish
episodes.overview: Riff takes care of some baby duck eggs.

episodes.name: Mother Goose
episodes.overview: Characters from The Land of Mother Goose come to the caboose in search for their lost things.

episodes.name: Fairy Tales
episodes.overview: Barney tells Baby Bop the story of Pandora's Box while she waits for her surprise.

episodes.name: Things I Can Do
episodes.overview: Baby Bop becomes frustrated that there's one more thing that she can't do, and Barney, Riff and the kids help her find something that she can do.

episodes.name: Differences
episodes.overview: When the kids leave a boy in a wheelchair out of their fun, Barney decides to let him know that he feels the same way sometimes.

episodes.name: Dancing
episodes.overview: Barney encourages Jamal to dance at the dance party.

episodes.name: Singing
episodes.overview: Barney tells the story called "The Princess Without a Song to Sing" where a princess found her song with the help of a very wise king.

episodes.name: Neighborhoods
episodes.overview: Riff loses his drumsticks, so Barney and the others help him find them by looking around their neighborhood in the park.

episodes.name: Careers
episodes.overview: Baby Bop wants to be three forever, until Barney shows her the fun of taking on a grown-up job.

episodes.name: China
episodes.overview: BJ's Chinese Pen Pal visits the park.

episodes.name: Kenya
episodes.overview: Kenyan dancers and musicians are performing in the park! Baby Bop loves dancing, while Riff loves music. But when they are asked to do opposite roles, they learn to appreciate both dancing and music.

episodes.name: Pistachio
episodes.overview: After Barney eats too many pistachios, his friends show him the importance of eating them in moderation.

episodes.name: Full Team Ahead
episodes.overview: BJ excludes his cousin from his baseball team, after not having any athletic ability. Barney teaches him that the best way to play baseball is to share the experience with all of his friends.

episodes.name: The Magic Words
episodes.overview: When Baby Bop forgets to use "Please" and "Thank You", Barney tells her the story of "The Princess and the Magic Words" where a princess could not say the magic words because she did not use them often.

episodes.name: Litterbot
episodes.overview: Riff creates a robot that cleans up trash from the park. When the robot malfunctions, it's up to Riff and his friends to lend a helping hand.

episodes.name: Bop 'til You Drop
episodes.overview: After Baby Bop loses her pink balloon, her friends give her a whistle to signal for them to play together. When she becomes too bossy, Barney teaches her the importance of being a good friend.

episodes.name: The Sleepless Sleepover
episodes.overview: Barney helps Melanie get over her fear of sleeping outside tonight at a sleepover campout in the park.

episodes.name: Little Red Rockin' Hood
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop, BJ, Riff and the kids put on a twist on a classic fairy tale story of "Little Red Rockin' Hood" where a wolf and a young girl combined their music together to form "Country Rock."

episodes.name: The Whole Truth
episodes.overview: After BJ takes credit for Sarah's painting, Barney teaches him to always be honest with his friends.

episodes.name: The Wind and the Sun
episodes.overview: When Baby Bop and BJ fight to use the same place in the park, Barney tells them the story called "The Wind and the Sun"

episodes.name: The Nature of Things
episodes.overview: After Rachel makes a mess in the park, she dreams about how littering affects many animal homes.

episodes.name: The New Kid
episodes.overview: After Riff befriends a new kid, BJ fears that Riff is not his friend any more.

episodes.name: Grandpa's Visit
episodes.overview: Ryan's grandfather visits the park in search of a special bird.

episodes.name: The Big Garden
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop, BJ and the kids harvest crops in the garden in the park.

episodes.name: Listen!
episodes.overview: Barney's friends help Detective Riff figure out where a strange noise is coming from.

episodes.name: Lost and Found
episodes.overview: After promising he would take care of the circus tickets, BJ loses them and sets out to find them.

episodes.name: Pot Full of Sunshine
episodes.overview: Baby Bop helps take care of a flower. After her flower died, Barney and the kids help her feel better.

episodes.name: Trail Boss Barney
episodes.overview: Barney takes his friends to a working ranch.

episodes.name: Get Happy!
episodes.overview: Riff creates a device to make Olivia happy.

episodes.name: For the Fun of It
episodes.overview: BJ wants to learn a basketball trick just like his friend Terry. Through the process, he learns the importance of perseverance.

episodes.name: Starlight, Star Bright
episodes.overview: During a sleepover campout, Baby Bop sees a shooting star and wonders where it had gone.

episodes.name: Big as Barney
episodes.overview: After observing the positive impact Barney has on his friends, Ryan decides that he wants to act and look just like Barney.

episodes.name: No, No, No!
episodes.overview: Baby Bop is frustrated about hearing "No" all the time. So, Barney tells her the story of Cinderella.

episodes.name: The Emperor's Contest
episodes.overview: After Ryan thinks about cheating in a fishing contest, Barney tells him a story about how a boy became emperor by being honest.

episodes.name: Beethoven's Hear!
episodes.overview: After Riff wonders if he would still like music if he was deaf, Barney introduces one of the best deaf musicians of all time - Beethoven.

episodes.name: Guess Who?
episodes.overview: Riff decides on a costume for the Halloween Party.

episodes.name: Sweet Treats
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop, BJ, Riff and the kids go trick-or-treating at the Halloween party in the park. After Ramon loses all his Halloween candies, BJ shares his Halloween candies with him.

episodes.name: Best in Show
episodes.overview: Susan lets BJ enter her dog Pilgrim in a dog show!

episodes.name: The Chase
episodes.overview: After the kids fight over wanting to do the same thing, Barney tells them a Native American story that teaches to be yourself and not follow to the crowd.

episodes.name: Dream Big
episodes.overview: Hoping to go to Mars in outer space, Riff builds his own rocket ship. When his plans do not succeed, Barney teaches him the importance of sticking to his dreams.

episodes.name: That's What a Mommy Is
episodes.overview: After witnessing many helpful and caring mothers in the park, Baby Bop wonders what makes a really good mommy.

episodes.name: The Shrinking Blankey
episodes.overview: Baby Bop is concerned that she may be outgrowing her blankey.

episodes.name: The Awful Tooth
episodes.overview: Barney and his friends help Riff overcome his fear of the dentist.

episodes.name: The Blame Game
episodes.overview: Marcos accidentally breaks Melanie's project and fears that she may not want to be his friend anymore. Barney teaches him that a good friend is an honest friend.

episodes.name: What's Your Name?
episodes.overview: Myra believes that her name is boring. So, Barney's friends figure out the origin of their names.

episodes.name: The Magic Caboose
episodes.overview: Barney and the kids board the magic caboose to take pretend trips to different countries.

episodes.name: BJ the Great
episodes.overview: BJ wants to become a great magician, but does not want to practice. When he thinks he has turned his sister into a turtle, he learns that practice makes perfect.

episodes.name: Gift of the Dinos
episodes.overview: During a secret santa session, BJ and Riff decide to give up their prized possessions to give the ultimate gift to each other.

episodes.name: A Visit to Santa
episodes.overview: Melanie misses the mailman when she wasn't getting her Christmas letter to him on time, so Barney takes her on a trip to Santa's workshop at the North Pole to deliver her Christmas wish list to Santa.

episodes.name: Riff's Musical Zoo
episodes.overview: After Tracy's Mom can't take the kids to the zoo, Riff uses stuffed animals and musical instruments to mimic animals sounds to create a "musical zoo"!

episodes.name: The Princess and the Frog
episodes.overview: After Baby Bop promises Ryan to watch his pet frog, Barney tells her the story of "The Princess and the Frog" to remind her to always keep her promises.

episodes.name: Way to Go!: A Travel Adventure
episodes.overview: Daniel explains to Barney, Baby Bop, BJ, and the kids how he and his family will use different modes of transportation on their cruise vacation. With a little imagination, Barney, Baby Bop, BJ, and the kids use boxes to build some cars, a plane, a bus, and a cruise ship.

episodes.name: The Misbegotten Moon, A Space Adventure
episodes.overview: Baby Bop sees a half-moon & thinks the moon is broken. Barney takes her to see the Man in the Moon.

episodes.name: The Sword In The Sandbox, A Storybook Adventure
episodes.overview: Daniel wants to jump rope with some older children but is afraid he is too little to do it right.

episodes.name: Riff to the Rescue!: A Wild West Adventure
episodes.overview: When Riff is asked to be captain of a baseball team, he doesn't think he can do it. Barney and friends give him the courage to try by recounting the tale of his great-great-grandfather Riffle - the Wild West hero!

episodes.name: Lights! Camera! Action!: A Movie Adventure
episodes.overview: Melanie comes up with the perfect idea to get people to donate to Grace's food drive - put on a movie premiere in the caboose! Barney and friends pitch in to help, but they all have different ideas about what kind of movie to make. Everything they try falls apart. It's curtains for Melanie's movie until she comes up with a blockbuster idea of her own.

episodes.name: To Catch A Thief, A Mystery Adventure
episodes.overview: Detective BJ is on the case when several sports balls suddenly disappear. Determined to find the mysterious ball thief, BJ falsely accuses Riff of being the thief. BJ learns he cannot jump to conclusions and must find the whole story to see who the thief really is.

episodes.name: The Magic Lamp a Travel Adventure
episodes.overview: Celebrating her birthday in the park with friends, Layla is more interested in hot dogs than her mother's Middle Eastern food. When Barney reads the story of "Aladdin and the Magic Lamp," Layla is transported to a Middle Eastern marketplace where she learns different cultures have many exciting foods and customs to offer.

episodes.name: The Amazing Captain Pickles: A Hero Adventure
episodes.overview: BJ learns a lesson about bragging when, playing superhero Captain Pickles, he tells everyone that he can leap over the moon.

episodes.name: A Game For Everyone, A Sports Adventure
episodes.overview: Barney sets up a sports day in the park. Baby Bop encourages a special needs child to join the fun.

episodes.name: The Reluctant Dragon, A Fairy Tale Adventure
episodes.overview: When the kids in the park think a spider looks creepy, Barney tells the story of "The Reluctant Dragon," another "creepy" creature... or so he seemed, until you got to know him.

episodes.name: Bienvenido Barney: Mexico
episodes.overview: Baby Bop's friend Monty the butterfly passes through the park with a flock of friends on their way to Mexico. When Monty gets left behind by his insect friends and family, Barney takes everyone on a visit to Mexico, where Baby Bop will say good-bye to her butterfly friend.

episodes.name: Big Brother Rusty: China
episodes.overview: arney's excited to find out that Rusty's family is adopting a new baby girl from China; however, Rusty's not sure if he's going to be a good brother, and he doesn't know much about China. Barney shows Rusty and the others some info China on the computer and BJ and Baby Bop talk about siblings. Through Barney's Travel Book, Barney takes Rusty, BJ and Baby Bop on an adventure to China where he can learn more about his new sister's heritage. When they get there, the people are celebrating Chinese New Year. From lion dances and talented performers to tasty treats and puppet shows, the celebration never runs out of fun.

episodes.name: Ahora Mismo: Spain
episodes.overview: Ben is late to the park and is disappointed to realize he missed his chance at riding a real pony. He has waited his whole life for this, and now it looks as if he’s missed his opportunity. Luckily, Barney takes him to Spain where they meet Regalo, a dancing horse with Riff and Baby Bop. Ben and Barney return to the park just in time for Ben to ride the pony after all! Ben is thrilled to ride a horse and learned an important lesson about patience and waiting.

episodes.name: Venice, Anyone?: Italy
episodes.overview: Emma is stuck with a school project and can't play soccer with Joshua. Having to interview her parents and get info about an interesting ancestor, she is frustrated with the assignment. Barney helps her discover that her ancestors were from Venice, Italy. Using his Travel Book, Barney takes Josh, Emma, and Riff to Venice. He gives his friends a gondola ride as well as telling them about famous explorer Marco Polo. Barney's friend Anna Maria tells Emma that she knew her great grandfather and takes her to his shop, where they try on masks and make some of their own. Emma learns that if she makes the mask in parts, she'll get it done. Barney reminds her of this lesson, so she will do the same for her school project.

episodes.name: Sweeter Than Candy: Greece
episodes.overview: Barney, Baby Bop and BJ are helping the kids get ready for a school play. Barney tells everyone that putting on shows began in Greece. Of course, the little dinos and kids want to visit the country, so off they go! While there, they meet some Greek friends and decide to put on a play in an amphitheatre. Barney knows a great story that originated in Greece called “King Midas.” By the end of the day, everyone has learned that wanting too much is not a good thing, especially BJ!

episodes.name: The Music Box: Switzerland
episodes.overview: The kids are having a yard sale, getting rid of old toys, books and clothes. Kioko shows up holding a prized possession-a music box from Switzerland. By accident, Ben includes the music box in a cardboard box of yard sale items-and the music box is sold! Kioko is sad and Ben wants to make things right, so he and Barney travel to Switzerland in search of a replacement gift. While there, they sample Swiss food, customs and games-but no music box! Luckily when Ben returns the music box is returned!

episodes.name: The Good Egg: Kenya
episodes.overview: When the kids find a mysterious, colorful egg in the park, Barney takes them on a trip to Kenya to try to find out what kind of animal could have laid the egg. While in Kenya, they meet Ayira who introduces them to many people, cultures and animals of Kenya!

episodes.name: A Bird of a Different Feather: Hawaii
episodes.overview: What started out as a day of play, suddenly turns into a search for a "Bird of Paradise" that Tracy needs for her school project. Ben tells her that it's a rare bird, and they are only found in Hawaii. Barney then takes the kids to Hawaii, using his Travel Book. There they learn different words, how to make leis and even a hula dance. In the end everyone finds out that the "Bird of Paradise" is actually a flower, not a bird.

episodes.name: Bonjour Barney!: France
episodes.overview: Emma wants to paint an award-winning painting for the "Art In The Park Show," but she is just isn't satisfied with her artwork. Barney takes her to France to learn how to paint from his friend Pierre. While there, they learn about France and how to "paint by following your heart!"

episodes.name: Home Sweet Earth: The Rainforest
episodes.overview: It's Earth Day, a great time for everyone to learn how to help take care of our world, but Ben is wasting paper while BJ isn't too concerned about cutting down a tree to make room for a new playground. After a trip to the rainforest and a meeting with Mother Nature, everyone learns the importance of taking care of our world. As Earth Day comes to an end, Barney reminds us all that taking good care of our Earth is the natural thing to do…for the people we love.

episodes.name: Gift of the Dinos and Winter
episodes.overview: Gift of the Dinos: At Christmastime, BJ dreams of getting a brand new baseball glove, while Riff hopes for brand new drumsticks. Barney reminds them both that Christmas is about more than just getting gifts. Winter: Baby Bop waits for the first snowfall of the year!

episodes.name: Riff's Musical Zoo and Boats
episodes.overview: Riff's Musical Zoo: After Tracy's Mom can't take the kids to the zoo, Riff uses stuffed animals and musical instruments to mimic animals sounds to create a "musical zoo"! Boats BJ and Riff build a make-believe boat for Baby Bop to ride.

episodes.name: The Magic Caboose and Arts
episodes.overview: The Magical Caboose: Barney and the kids board the caboose and use their imagination to go to different places. They visit Egypt, Tahiti, and India. Arts: Barney introduces his friends to many different kinds of art.

episodes.name: Movement and Separation
episodes.overview: Movement: Coach Baby Bop and BJ help Barney prepare for the sack race. Separation: Baby Bop misses BJ and Riff, when they go off on a camping trip.

episodes.name: Pistachio and BJ's Snack Attack
episodes.overview: Pistachio: BJ, Baby Bop, and Riff think that Barney is eating too many pistachio but he can't stop eating them. BJ's Snack Attack: After BJ eats too many treats, he dreams a world of only sweet treats.

episodes.name: Bop 'til You Drop and Sharing
episodes.overview: Bop 'til You Drop: Barney steps in when Baby Bop gets a little too pushy and bossy with her friends after losing her pink balloon. Sharing: After Riff breaks BJ's scooter, he sells his old stuff to buy a new one!

episodes.name: Little Red Rockin' Hood and Differences
episodes.overview: Little Red Rockin' Hood: Barney, Baby Bop, BJ, Riff, and the kids tell the story of how a country singer and Rock-N-Roll wolf blended their music together and created Country Rock! Differences: When the kids leave a wheelchair kid out of the fun, Barney decides to let him know that sometimes he feels the same way too.

episodes.name: Butterflies and The Nature of Things
episodes.overview: Butterflies: Barney, Baby Bop, and Riff help Baby Bop find her butterfly Monty. The Nature of Things: After Rachel litters in the park, she has a dream about how the litter affects animal homes.

episodes.name: China and Welcome, Cousin Riff
episodes.overview: China: BJ's Chinese Pen Pal visits the park! Welcome, Cousin Riff: Barney informs Baby Bop and BJ that their cousin Riff has moved into town!

episodes.name: Rabbits and Listen!
episodes.overview: Rabbits: Detective BJ helps Baby Bop figure out which animal is eating her snacks Listen!: When the kids hear a mysterious noise in the park, Detective Riff is on the case!

episodes.name: The Big Garden and Get Happy!
episodes.overview: The Big Garden: Barney and his friends harvest crops in their garden! Get Happy!: After Olivia is sad, Riff invents a device to make her happy again!

episodes.name: Big as Barney and The Chase
episodes.overview: Big as Barney: After seeing how Barney helps many people, Ryan wishes he could be more like Barney. When he pretends to be more like Barney, Barney teaches him that he can help people by just being himself. The Chase: After the kids fight over wanting to do the same thing, Barney tells them a Native American story that teaches to be yourself and not follow the crowd.

episodes.name: Playing Games and No, No, No!
episodes.overview: Playing Games: Barney teaches Baby Bop to follow the rules of the game.

episodes.name: The Emperor's Contest and The Whole Truth
episodes.overview: The Emperor's Contest: After Ryan thinks of cheating during a fishing contest, Barney tells him a story about how a boy became emperor for being honest. The Whole Truth: BJ takes credit for Sarah's picture, thinking his friends would like him better if he was a great artist. Barney teaches him that his friends like him for who he is.

episodes.name: Seeing and Beethoven's Hear!
episodes.overview: Seeing: Baby Bop is playing hide-and-seek with an elephant! Beethoven's Hear: After Riff wonders if he would still like music if he was deaf, Barney introduces one of the best deaf musician of all time - Beethoven.

episodes.name: Best in Show and Ducks and Fish
episodes.overview: Best in Show: Susan lets BJ enter her dog Pilgrim in a dog show! Ducks and Fish: Riff care for some duck eggs!

episodes.name: The Shrinking Blankey and Things I Can Do
episodes.overview: The Shrinking Blankey: Baby Bop is worried that she is outgrowing her blankey. Things I Can Do: Barney and his friends show off things they can do!

episodes.name: Mother Goose and Fun with Reading
episodes.overview: Mother Goose: Characters from The Land of Mother Goose come to the caboose in search for their lost things. Fun with Reading: After BJ gets an injury while playing Captain Pickles, Barney and the kids have fun with books. They even write their own story!

episodes.name: The Blame Game and Airplanes
episodes.overview: The Blame Game: After Marcos accidently breaks Melanie's project, he's afraid that she would not be his friend anymore. Barney teaches him that good friends are always honest to each other! Airplanes: BJ has fun with his toy airplane. But when Riff's curiousity causes him to mess up BJ's toy, can BJ put it back together?

episodes.name: The New Kid/The Princess and the Frog
episodes.overview: The New Kid: After Riff makes friends with new kid Noah, BJ becomes jealous and thinks he is not Riff's friend anymore. Barney teaches him that you can always keep your old friendships and make new ones too. The Princess and the Frog: After Baby Bop promises Ryan to watch his pet frog, Barney tells her the story of "The Princess and the Frog" to remind her to always keep her promises.
